perturbation.original_text: TERM This term of this Agreement and the rights and obligations of the Parties hereto shall commence as of the Effective Date and shall continue in perpetuity (the "Term"), unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions contained herein.
perturbation.changed_text: TERM This term of this Agreement and the rights and obligations of the Parties hereto shall commence as of the Effective Date and shall continue for an initial period of one (1) year (the "Term"), automatically renewable for successive one (1) year periods unless either party provides written notice of non-renewal at least thirty (30) days prior to the end of the then-current term, unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions contained herein.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the term is in 'perpetuity,' creating a never-ending agreement, which is a very strong commitment. The changed version limits the term to an initial period of one year, then auto-renews for another one year, unless the party provides written notice. The 'perpetuity' clause now contradicts the idea of 'auto-renews,' making the agreement's time commitment and renewal terms unclear.

perturbation.original_text: Ehave warrants that for the duration of the Term, (i) the Ehave Companion Solution will substantially conform to and operate in accordance with, and have the functions and features set out in, the Specifications, and any related documentation provided by Ehave, and any such documentation shall be complete and accurate in all material respects; and the Ehave Companion Solution will not contain any material undocumented feature; (ii) Ehave has implemented and will maintain industry standard protection for the detection, protection and removal of Viruses; (iii) Ehave will perform all services under this Agreement in a timely, professional and workmanlike manner using personnel of required skill, experience and qualifications, and will devote adequate resources to meet its obligations (including the Service Level Commitments and its support obligations) hereunder; (iv) it has or will have all necessary right, power and authority, including all licenses and Intellectual Property Rights required, to provide and operate the Ehave Companion Solution and to grant all rights and licenses granted or required to be granted by it under this Agreement; and (v) Ehave is not aware of any infringement or misappropriation claims by any third party in relation to the Ehave Companion Solution.
perturbation.changed_text: Ehave warrants that for the duration of the Term, (i) the Ehave Companion Solution will substantially conform to and operate in accordance with, and have the functions and features set out in, the Specifications, and any related documentation provided by Ehave, and any such documentation is provided on an 'as is' basis; and the Ehave Companion Solution may contain undocumented features; (ii) Ehave will use commercially reasonable efforts to maintain industry standard protection for the detection, protection and removal of Viruses; (iii) Ehave will attempt to perform all services under this Agreement in a timely and professional manner using personnel of required skill, experience and qualifications, and will devote reasonable resources to meet its obligations (including the Service Level Commitments and its support obligations) hereunder; (iv) it has or will use commercially reasonable efforts to have all necessary right, power and authority, including all licenses and Intellectual Property Rights required, to provide and operate the Ehave Companion Solution and to grant all rights and licenses granted or required to be granted by it under this Agreement; and (v) Ehave makes no warranty regarding infringement or misappropriation claims by any third party in relation to the Ehave Companion Solution.
perturbation.explanation: The original text guarantees the solution will conform to specification and not have undocumented features, while the modified text delivers the documentation on an 'as is' basis, creating contradiction in guarantee. The original text says Ehave 'will' implement and perform, while the modified text says Ehave 'will attempt to' and 'will use commercially reasonable effort' creating a 'best effort' but not a guarantee. The original says Ehave says it 'is not aware of any infringement claims', while the modified says 'makes no warranty regarding infringement or misappropriation claims'. By changing the wording from firm commitments to 'best efforts' and disclaimers, it introduces uncertainty about the service's quality and legal security.

perturbation.original_text: OWNERSHIP (a) Ehave's Ownership CHT acknowledges and agrees that, as between CHT and Ehave, Ehave owns all worldwide right, title and interest, including all Intellectual Property Rights, in and to the Ehave Companion Solution, including any developments, enhancements or customizations made as a result of Section 3 and any modifications, enhancements, upgrades, updates or Customization subsequent to the development and implementation in accordance with Section 3, excluding, however, any CHT Developments. CHT does not acquire any rights, title or ownership interests of any kind whatsoever, express or implied, in any of the foregoing other than the licenses granted herein. (b) CHT's Ownership Ehave acknowledges and agrees that, as between Ehave and CHT, CHT owns all worldwide right, title and interest, including all Intellectual Property Rights, in and to the CHT Developments. Ehave does not acquire any rights, title or ownership interests of any kind whatsoever, express or implied, in any of the foregoing other than the licenses granted herein. Further, as between CHT and Ehave, (i) CHT (or its End User) is and will remain the sole and exclusive owner of all right, title, and interest in and to End User Data, including all Intellectual Property Rights therein and/or relating thereto, subject only to the limited license granted in Section 5(c), and (ii) End User Data and CHT Developments are and will be the Confidential Information of CHT. CHT and End Users shall at all times, including in the event of termination of this Agreement and for a period thereafter as set out in Section 10(e), have access to their respective End User Data and the ability to download and/or export their End User Data out of the Ehave Companion Solution.
perturbation.changed_text: OWNERSHIP (a) Ehave's Ownership CHT acknowledges and agrees that, as between CHT and Ehave, Ehave owns all worldwide right, title and interest, including all Intellectual Property Rights, in and to the Ehave Companion Solution, including any developments, enhancements or customizations made as a result of Section 3 and any modifications, enhancements, upgrades, updates or Customization subsequent to the development and implementation in accordance with Section 3, excluding, however, any CHT Developments. CHT does not acquire any rights, title or ownership interests of any kind whatsoever, express or implied, in any of the foregoing other than the licenses granted herein. Ehave shall have the right to all aggregated and anonymized data generated from the use of the Ehave Companion Solution. (b) CHT's Ownership Ehave acknowledges and agrees that, as between Ehave and CHT, CHT owns all worldwide right, title and interest, including all Intellectual Property Rights, in and to the CHT Developments. Ehave does not acquire any rights, title or ownership interests of any kind whatsoever, express or implied, in any of the foregoing other than the licenses granted herein. Further, as between CHT and Ehave, (i) CHT (or its End User) is and will remain the sole and exclusive owner of all right, title, and interest in and to End User Data, including all Intellectual Property Rights therein and/or relating thereto, subject only to the limited license granted in Section 5(c), and (ii) End User Data and CHT Developments are and will be the Confidential Information of CHT. CHT and End Users shall not be entitled to export data if there is any outstanding payments due.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states CHT owns End User Data, but this is conflicted by a condition in the modified text that Ehave 'shall have the right to all aggregated and anonymized data generated from the use of the Ehave Companion Solution,' it implies ownership of data derived from End User Data, creating a potential conflict. The original text granted the user the ability to export data at any time, while the modified text says 'CHT and End Users shall not be entitled to export data if there is any outstanding payments due' creating a direct conflict with the previously stated, unlimited access.
